# Regulatory Affairs Capability Taxonomy

**Version**: 1.0.0  
**Date**: November 27, 2025  
**Status**: Auto-Generated for Seeding

---

## REGULATORY AFFAIRS CAPABILITIES (50)

### LEADERSHIP & STRATEGIC (4)

**CAP-RA-001: Chief Regulatory Officer Leadership**
- **Name**: Chief Regulatory Officer Leadership
- **Definition**: Executive regulatory leadership setting global regulatory strategy, policy, and ensuring enterprise-wide regulatory compliance.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER
- **Roles**: Chief Regulatory Officer
- **Related Skills**: Executive Leadership, Regulatory Strategy, Global Policy, Board Relations

**CAP-RA-002: VP Regulatory Affairs Strategy**
- **Name**: VP Regulatory Affairs Strategy
- **Definition**: VP-level development and execution of multi-region regulatory strategy across portfolio.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER
- **Roles**: VP Regulatory Affairs
- **Related Skills**: Portfolio Strategy, Multi-region Regulatory, Budget Management, Team Leadership

**CAP-RA-003: Regulatory Affairs Directorate**
- **Name**: Regulatory Affairs Directorate
- **Definition**: Leading regulatory affairs function or therapeutic area at director level with strategic oversight.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER, L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Regulatory Affairs Director, Senior Director Regulatory
- **Related Skills**: Functional Leadership, Regulatory Planning, Team Management, KPI Oversight

**CAP-RA-004: Regulatory Project Management**
- **Name**: Regulatory Project Management
- **Definition**: Managing complex regulatory projects across multiple submissions and jurisdictions with cross-functional teams.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Project Manager, Regulatory Lead
- **Related Skills**: Project Planning, Timeline Management, Resource Allocation, Risk Management

---

### SUBMISSIONS & FILINGS (7)

**CAP-RA-005: IND/CTA Preparation & Management**
- **Name**: IND/CTA Preparation & Management
- **Definition**: Preparing and managing Investigational New Drug (IND) and Clinical Trial Application (CTA) submissions.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Affairs Manager, IND Manager
- **Related Skills**: IND Writing, CTA Preparation, FDA/EMA Interaction, Protocol Review

**CAP-RA-006: NDA/BLA Preparation & Submission**
- **Name**: NDA/BLA Preparation & Submission
- **Definition**: End-to-end preparation and submission of New Drug Applications (NDA) and Biologics License Applications (BLA).
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: NDA Manager, Regulatory Affairs Manager
- **Related Skills**: NDA Authoring, Module Compilation, eCTD Publishing, Deficiency Response

**CAP-RA-007: MAA/Centralised Procedure Preparation**
- **Name**: MAA/Centralised Procedure Preparation
- **Definition**: Preparing Marketing Authorization Applications (MAA) for EMA centralised procedure.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: EU Regulatory Affairs Manager, MAA Lead
- **Related Skills**: EMA Procedures, CTD Format, Rapporteur Management, EU Regulations

**CAP-RA-008: Global Registration Strategy**
- **Name**: Global Registration Strategy
- **Definition**: Developing and executing global registration strategies across multiple markets and regulatory pathways.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER, L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Global Regulatory Affairs Director, Senior Regulatory Manager
- **Related Skills**: Market Sequencing, Regulatory Intelligence, Multi-region Strategy, Portfolio Planning

**CAP-RA-009: Supplements & Variation Management**
- **Name**: Supplements & Variation Management
- **Definition**: Managing post-approval changes through supplements, variations, and amendments.
- **Level Scope**: L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Affairs Specialist, Lifecycle Manager
- **Related Skills**: Change Control, Variation Types, Impact Assessment, Regulatory Maintenance

**CAP-RA-010: Orphan Drug Designation & Pediatric Plans**
- **Name**: Orphan Drug Designation & Pediatric Plans
- **Definition**: Obtaining orphan drug designations and developing pediatric investigation plans (PIP/PSP).
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Orphan Drug Specialist, Pediatric Regulatory Manager
- **Related Skills**: ODD Application, PIP Preparation, Rare Disease Expertise, Incentive Programs

**CAP-RA-011: Breakthrough & Expedited Pathways**
- **Name**: Breakthrough & Expedited Pathways
- **Definition**: Navigating expedited regulatory pathways including breakthrough, fast track, priority review, and accelerated approval.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Senior Regulatory Affairs Manager, Expedited Pathways Lead
- **Related Skills**: FDA Programs, Breakthrough Designation, Accelerated Approval, Agency Negotiation

---

### CMC REGULATORY (5)

**CAP-RA-012: CMC Regulatory Strategy & Documentation**
- **Name**: CMC Regulatory Strategy & Documentation
- **Definition**: Developing CMC regulatory strategy and authoring Module 3 (Quality) documentation.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: CMC Regulatory Manager, Quality Regulatory Specialist
- **Related Skills**: Module 3 Writing, ICH Q Guidelines, Manufacturing Documentation, Specifications

**CAP-RA-013: Manufacturing & Facility Registration**
- **Name**: Manufacturing & Facility Registration
- **Definition**: Registering manufacturing facilities and preparing Drug Master Files (DMFs).
- **Level Scope**: L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: CMC Regulatory Specialist, Facility Registration Lead
- **Related Skills**: DMF Preparation, Site Master File, GMP Compliance, Facility Inspections

**CAP-RA-014: Pharmaceutical Development & Specifications**
- **Name**: Pharmaceutical Development & Specifications
- **Definition**: Regulatory review and approval of pharmaceutical development strategies and product specifications.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: CMC Regulatory Manager, Development Regulatory Lead
- **Related Skills**: Specification Setting, Analytical Methods, Stability Programs, QbD Principles

**CAP-RA-015: Comparability & Lifecycle Management (CMC)**
- **Name**: Comparability & Lifecycle Management (CMC)
- **Definition**: Managing CMC changes through comparability protocols and lifecycle management strategies.
- **Level Scope**: L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: CMC Lifecycle Manager, Comparability Specialist
- **Related Skills**: Comparability Protocols, Post-approval Changes, Scale-up, Process Validation

**CAP-RA-016: Biologics & Advanced Therapy Regulatory**
- **Name**: Biologics & Advanced Therapy Regulatory
- **Definition**: Specialized regulatory expertise in biologics, cell therapy, gene therapy, and advanced therapeutic medicinal products (ATMP).
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Biologics Regulatory Manager, ATMP Specialist
- **Related Skills**: Biologics Regulations, ATMP Guidelines, Cell/Gene Therapy, Biosimilars

---

### LABELING (4)

**CAP-RA-017: Core Labeling Development**
- **Name**: Core Labeling Development
- **Definition**: Developing core product labeling including prescribing information, SmPC, and package leaflets.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Labeling Manager, Regulatory Labeling Specialist
- **Related Skills**: Label Writing, SmPC Development, Package Insert, Prescribing Information

**CAP-RA-018: Labeling Negotiation & Defense**
- **Name**: Labeling Negotiation & Defense
- **Definition**: Negotiating labeling with health authorities and defending proposed label claims.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Senior Labeling Manager, Regulatory Negotiations Lead
- **Related Skills**: Agency Negotiation, Claim Defense, Scientific Rationale, Risk/Benefit Analysis

**CAP-RA-019: Global Labeling Harmonization**
- **Name**: Global Labeling Harmonization
- **Definition**: Harmonizing product labeling across multiple regions while meeting local requirements.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Global Labeling Manager, Harmonization Specialist
- **Related Skills**: Global Alignment, Local Adaptation, Translation Management, Regional Requirements

**CAP-RA-020: Safety Labeling Updates**
- **Name**: Safety Labeling Updates
- **Definition**: Managing safety-related labeling updates including warnings, contraindications, and adverse reactions.
- **Level Scope**: L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Safety Labeling Specialist, Regulatory Safety Manager
- **Related Skills**: Safety Signal Assessment, CCDS Updates, Warning Management, Dear Doctor Letters

---

### HEALTH AUTHORITY INTERACTIONS (4)

**CAP-RA-021: Pre-Submission Meetings & Scientific Advice**
- **Name**: Pre-Submission Meetings & Scientific Advice
- **Definition**: Preparing for and conducting pre-submission meetings, End-of-Phase meetings, and scientific advice procedures.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Regulatory Affairs Manager, Scientific Advice Lead
- **Related Skills**: Meeting Preparation, Briefing Documents, Agency Presentation, Follow-up Actions

**CAP-RA-022: Agency Query Response & Negotiation**
- **Name**: Agency Query Response & Negotiation
- **Definition**: Responding to health authority information requests, deficiency letters, and conducting regulatory negotiations.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Affairs Manager, Query Response Lead
- **Related Skills**: Deficiency Response, Scientific Argumentation, Timeline Management, Agency Relations

**CAP-RA-023: Advisory Committee Preparation**
- **Name**: Advisory Committee Preparation
- **Definition**: Preparing for and presenting at FDA Advisory Committee (AdComm) meetings.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER, L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: AdComm Lead, Senior Regulatory Director
- **Related Skills**: AdComm Strategy, Presentation Development, Public Hearing, Panel Engagement

**CAP-RA-024: Inspection Management & Agency Audit Support**
- **Name**: Inspection Management & Agency Audit Support
- **Definition**: Managing regulatory inspections, audits, and providing facility support during agency visits.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Inspection Lead, Regulatory Compliance Manager
- **Related Skills**: Inspection Readiness, GCP/GMP Audits, 483 Response, CAPA Management

---

### INTELLIGENCE & COMPLIANCE (4)

**CAP-RA-025: Regulatory Intelligence & Horizon Scanning**
- **Name**: Regulatory Intelligence & Horizon Scanning
- **Definition**: Monitoring global regulatory landscape, guideline updates, and emerging regulatory trends.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Intelligence Manager, RI Specialist
- **Related Skills**: Regulatory Monitoring, Guideline Tracking, Impact Assessment, Trend Analysis

**CAP-RA-026: Regulatory Compliance Monitoring**
- **Name**: Regulatory Compliance Monitoring
- **Definition**: Monitoring regulatory compliance across operations, identifying gaps, and implementing corrective actions.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Compliance Manager, Quality Assurance
- **Related Skills**: Compliance Audits, Gap Analysis, CAPA Systems, Regulatory Standards

**CAP-RA-027: Regulatory Policy & Advocacy**
- **Name**: Regulatory Policy & Advocacy
- **Definition**: Engaging in regulatory policy development, industry advocacy, and trade association activities.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER, L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: VP Regulatory, Regulatory Policy Director
- **Related Skills**: Policy Development, Industry Advocacy, Trade Associations, Public Affairs

**CAP-RA-028: Regulatory Training & SOP Development**
- **Name**: Regulatory Training & SOP Development
- **Definition**: Developing regulatory training programs and standard operating procedures for regulatory operations.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Training Manager, SOP Lead
- **Related Skills**: Training Development, SOP Writing, Regulatory Education, Knowledge Management

---

### LIFECYCLE MANAGEMENT (3)

**CAP-RA-029: Product Lifecycle Management (Regulatory)**
- **Name**: Product Lifecycle Management (Regulatory)
- **Definition**: Strategic regulatory lifecycle management from development through commercialization to end-of-life.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Lifecycle Regulatory Manager, Product Regulatory Lead
- **Related Skills**: Lifecycle Strategy, Portfolio Management, Risk-Based Planning, Regulatory Maintenance

**CAP-RA-030: Post-Approval Commitments & Studies**
- **Name**: Post-Approval Commitments & Studies
- **Definition**: Managing post-marketing requirements (PMR), post-marketing commitments (PMC), and post-authorization safety studies (PASS).
- **Level Scope**: L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: PMR/PMC Manager, Regulatory Specialist
- **Related Skills**: Commitment Tracking, Study Design, Reporting Requirements, Milestone Management

**CAP-RA-031: Regulatory Maintenance & Annual Reporting**
- **Name**: Regulatory Maintenance & Annual Reporting
- **Definition**: Maintaining regulatory approvals through annual reports, periodic safety updates, and renewal applications.
- **Level Scope**: L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Maintenance Specialist, Annual Report Lead
- **Related Skills**: Annual Reporting, Renewal Applications, Regulatory Tracking, Documentation Management

---

### RISK MANAGEMENT (4)

**CAP-RA-032: Risk Management Planning (RMP/REMS)**
- **Name**: Risk Management Planning (RMP/REMS)
- **Definition**: Developing and maintaining Risk Management Plans (RMP) and Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies (REMS).
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Risk Management Lead, REMS Manager
- **Related Skills**: RMP Development, REMS Design, Risk Minimization, Safety Surveillance

**CAP-RA-033: Regulatory Safety Reporting**
- **Name**: Regulatory Safety Reporting
- **Definition**: Managing regulatory safety reporting requirements including PSURs, PBRERs, and expedited reports.
- **Level Scope**: L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Safety Specialist, PSUR Manager
- **Related Skills**: PSUR/PBRER Preparation, Safety Reporting, Signal Detection, Regulatory Deadlines

**CAP-RA-034: Benefit-Risk Assessment (Regulatory)**
- **Name**: Benefit-Risk Assessment (Regulatory)
- **Definition**: Conducting and communicating benefit-risk assessments for regulatory submissions and lifecycle management.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Benefit-Risk Lead, Senior Regulatory Manager
- **Related Skills**: B-R Framework, Quantitative Analysis, Risk Communication, Agency Alignment

**CAP-RA-035: Crisis Management & Regulatory Issues**
- **Name**: Crisis Management & Regulatory Issues
- **Definition**: Managing regulatory crises, product recalls, safety alerts, and urgent regulatory issues.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER, L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Regulatory Crisis Manager, VP Regulatory
- **Related Skills**: Crisis Management, Recall Management, Agency Communication, Issue Resolution

---

### CROSS-CUTTING REGULATORY CAPABILITIES (15)

**CAP-RA-036: Strategic Regulatory Thinking**
- **Name**: Strategic Regulatory Thinking
- **Definition**: High-level strategic thinking to align regulatory strategy with business objectives.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER, L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: VP Regulatory, Regulatory Director
- **Related Skills**: Strategic Planning, Business Acumen, Long-term Vision, Portfolio Strategy

**CAP-RA-037: Cross-Functional Regulatory Leadership**
- **Name**: Cross-Functional Regulatory Leadership
- **Definition**: Leading and influencing cross-functional teams across R&D, medical, commercial, and manufacturing.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER, L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Regulatory Director, Senior Manager
- **Related Skills**: Team Leadership, Stakeholder Management, Influence, Collaboration

**CAP-RA-038: Regulatory Budget & Resource Management**
- **Name**: Regulatory Budget & Resource Management
- **Definition**: Managing regulatory budgets, vendor contracts, and resource allocation.
- **Level Scope**: L1 MASTER, L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Regulatory Director, Functional Lead
- **Related Skills**: Budget Planning, Vendor Management, Resource Allocation, Financial Oversight

**CAP-RA-039: Regulatory Science & Guidelines Expertise**
- **Name**: Regulatory Science & Guidelines Expertise
- **Definition**: Deep expertise in regulatory science, ICH guidelines, and regional regulatory requirements.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Scientist, Guidelines Expert
- **Related Skills**: ICH Guidelines, Regulatory Science, Scientific Rationale, Guideline Interpretation

**CAP-RA-040: Regulatory Document Writing & Review**
- **Name**: Regulatory Document Writing & Review
- **Definition**: Authoring and reviewing high-quality regulatory documents with scientific accuracy and regulatory compliance.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Writer, Document Specialist
- **Related Skills**: Regulatory Writing, Document Review, Quality Control, eCTD Format

**CAP-RA-041: Clinical-Regulatory Integration**
- **Name**: Clinical-Regulatory Integration
- **Definition**: Integrating clinical development strategy with regulatory requirements and ensuring alignment.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Clinical Regulatory Lead, Integrated Manager
- **Related Skills**: Clinical Knowledge, Protocol Review, Endpoint Selection, Clinical-Regulatory Alignment

**CAP-RA-042: Data Analysis & Regulatory Interpretation**
- **Name**: Data Analysis & Regulatory Interpretation
- **Definition**: Analyzing clinical and non-clinical data for regulatory interpretation and submission strategy.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Scientist, Data Review Lead
- **Related Skills**: Data Analysis, Statistical Interpretation, Clinical Review, Scientific Assessment

**CAP-RA-043: Agency Communication & Relationship Management**
- **Name**: Agency Communication & Relationship Management
- **Definition**: Building and maintaining effective relationships with health authority personnel.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Senior Regulatory Manager, Agency Relations Lead
- **Related Skills**: Communication Skills, Relationship Building, Diplomacy, Agency Understanding

**CAP-RA-044: Regulatory Presentation & Advocacy**
- **Name**: Regulatory Presentation & Advocacy
- **Definition**: Presenting to health authorities, advisory panels, and internal stakeholders with scientific credibility.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Senior Manager, Presentation Lead
- **Related Skills**: Public Speaking, Slide Development, Q&A Management, Advocacy

**CAP-RA-045: Global Regulatory Coordination**
- **Name**: Global Regulatory Coordination
- **Definition**: Coordinating regulatory activities across multiple regions and ensuring global alignment.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Global Regulatory Manager, Regional Coordinator
- **Related Skills**: Global Coordination, Regional Expertise, Multi-market Strategy, Cultural Awareness

**CAP-RA-046: Regulatory Consulting & Advisory Services**
- **Name**: Regulatory Consulting & Advisory Services
- **Definition**: Providing regulatory consulting and advisory services to internal teams or external clients.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT
- **Roles**: Regulatory Consultant, Advisory Lead
- **Related Skills**: Consulting Skills, Advisory Services, Problem Solving, Client Management

**CAP-RA-047: Regulatory Systems & Technology Proficiency**
- **Name**: Regulatory Systems & Technology Proficiency
- **Definition**: Proficiency in regulatory information management systems, eCTD publishing, and regulatory technology.
- **Level Scope**: L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Regulatory Systems Specialist, RIMS Administrator
- **Related Skills**: RIMS, eCTD Tools, Document Management, IT Systems

**CAP-RA-048: Regulatory Quality & Compliance Assurance**
- **Name**: Regulatory Quality & Compliance Assurance
- **Definition**: Ensuring regulatory quality standards and compliance with SOPs, regulations, and best practices.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Quality Manager, Compliance Lead
- **Related Skills**: Quality Systems, Compliance Monitoring, Audit Management, QMS

**CAP-RA-049: Regulatory Process Optimization**
- **Name**: Regulatory Process Optimization
- **Definition**: Optimizing regulatory processes, workflows, and operational efficiency.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Process Excellence Lead, Regulatory Operations
- **Related Skills**: Process Improvement, Lean/Six Sigma, Workflow Design, Change Management

**CAP-RA-050: Timeline Management & Critical Path**
- **Name**: Timeline Management & Critical Path
- **Definition**: Managing regulatory timelines, critical path activities, and milestone tracking.
- **Level Scope**: L2 EXPERT, L3 SPECIALIST
- **Roles**: Timeline Manager, Project Lead
- **Related Skills**: Project Management, Timeline Planning, Critical Path Analysis, Milestone Tracking

---

**Total Regulatory Affairs Capabilities**: 50
